intro: Seddera erlangeriana, commonly known as the Erlanger's seddera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This species is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
